children.subject: Yeah the work is definitely going to be a problem, but I doubt 127+189 would be a lesser workload. In fact, I've heard people mention that balancing a heavy theory class like 189 with a coding class like 61c may be better than just going pure theory with both classes. Regardless, I'm not really factoring workload into the equation since either way I expect it to be a very heavy workload semester (simply because of how intense Sahai's 189 is reputed to be).
Then I recommend 61C + 189. 61C is a foundational class. Concepts from 61C are very important for software engineering.
I did 61C + 189. It was a bunch of work imo.

history.content: I recommend 127+189 as they have a lot of overlap throughout the semester. They really build of each other and contrary to what others say, I don't think 127 is a mandatory prereq for 189 (atleast in Fall 2019), but 126 definitely is.

children.subject: Definitely 127, since you are interested in ml research.
Take 127. It might actually be easier for you than 61c in fact if you are good at math.

I'd take 127+189, especially if you know for sure you're gonna take 189 next semester and not later. 61C is probably not gonna be super relevant to your interests, and though it's a required class, it’s typically not that hard to get into (unlike EE16B for instance, which is a required class but which has tons of reserved seats for different class levels).

Having taken both 61C and 127, I'd say 127 provides a better understanding for ml than 61C. However, 61C is a really fun class if you are just generally interested in computers. 127 was a lot less work than 61C in terms of what we actually turned in but to really get the material it took me a lot of time just studying the proofs from the textbooks.

Imho, 61c isn't really something I would take if I wasn't really interested in hardware/machine code.

history.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently finalizing my next semester's course plan and I'm really conflicted between taking 61C or 127. Regardless of which one I choose, I plan on taking 189 as my second tech. To provide a bit of context for my decision, I'm going to be a junior next year and am hoping to get into some form of ML research as soon as possible (since I've heard labs are hesitant to recruit seniors) so I want to get done with 189 early on. In this regard, some students have recommended I take 127 with 189 since a lot of the optimization concepts overlap and allow you to get more practice in as well as build a more solid base. On the other hand, I've been postponing taking 61C for a long while and I'm hesitant to push it back even further since it's a core lower-division class (although my interests do not lie in that sub-field of CS). Moreover, taking 127 the semester after 189 would allow me to focus more on the class (since most of my time next semester will likely be consumed by 189) and ensure that I get a better grade (which may be important for ML research since the course is relevant to the field). 

An important thing to note is that, considering the notoriety of Professor Sahai's iteration of 189, I intend to self-study both 127 and 189 during summer anyways. By doing so, I hope I can familiarize myself with enough of the course content to make up for the fact that I didn't take 127 before 189 (as the professor recommends). I'm currently taking 170 and 126 (with good grades in both) so I should be covered on that end.

Considering the above, which option would people recommend? Should I go with 61C + 189 or 127 + 189? 

Thanks for all the help in advance!
history.subject: 61C + 189 vs 127 + 189?
